001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.DomainObject;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
006
007/**
008 * Defines an initialization strategy for an {@link EstimationFunction}.
009 *
010 * <p>
011 * An {@code Initializer} is responsible for preparing an estimation
012 * function (e.g., a machine learning model) before training begins.
013 * This may involve setting parameter values, allocating resources,
014 * or performing other setup tasks required to ensure that the model
015 * starts from a valid and meaningful state.
016 * </p>
017 *
018 * <p>
019 * Different implementations can provide different initialization
020 * strategies, such as random initialization, Xavier/Glorot initialization,
021 * or restoring from a saved checkpoint.
022 * </p>
023 *
024 * @param <E> the type of estimation function being initialized
025 * @see EstimationFunction
026 */
027@DomainObject
028@Strategy(Strategy.Role.INTERFACE)
029public interface Initializer<E extends EstimationFunction> {
030
031    /**
032     * Initializes the given estimation function according to the
033     * initialization strategy defined by the implementation.
034     *
035     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function (model) to initialize
036     */
037    void initialize(E estimationFunction);
038
039}
